title: Customize Individual R Markdown Templates
text: Location: inst/indiedown (folder) Template assets stored folder inst/indiedown. folder contains necessary information customize markdown template. can contain basic pandoc settings, additional LaTeX settings dynamic pandoc settings.

title: Customize Individual R Markdown Templates
text: Location: default.yaml (required) default.yaml required element indiedown template. specifies default pandoc options used template. experiment pandoc options, simply add YAML header standard R Markdown document. relevant LaTeX options can set pandoc options. example, pandoc options allow set customized font user defined geometry. possible always prefer Pandoc options instead LaTeX (covered ), minimize unwanted interactions options. detailed description pandoc options, see ‘Variables LaTeX’ section pandoc Manual. default.yaml, well preamble.tex supports substitution variable <<indiedown_path>, explained .

title: Customize Individual R Markdown Templates
text: Location: preamble.tex (optional, advanced) Sometimes, pandoc options just enough. pandoc allows directly apply single LaTeX commands YAML header (using headers-include), preamble.tex offers convenient way include LaTeX commands beginning document. include commands, simply edit preamble.tex. Common options set preamble.tex modification section headings (e.g., \usepackage[small]{titlesec}), provision H float modifier (\usepackage{float}), packages used kableExtra. customizations, recommended turn default LaTeX title page, using \renewcommand\maketitle{}. Creating title page via LaTeX commands R Markdown script customized R function much easier flexible way create customized title page.

title: Customize Individual R Markdown Templates
text: Location: pre_processor.R (optional, advanced) cases, pandoc options set dynamically. E.g., geometry document depend whether uses two columns just one. pre_processor.R allows dynamically modify pandoc options, using plain R. See example script use .

title: Customize Individual R Markdown Templates
text: default.yaml, well preamble.tex supports substitution variable <<indiedown_path>. Whenever mention <<indiedown_path> one files, substituted path indiedown folder.

title: Customize Individual R Markdown Templates
text: customized styles include additional assets, logo special font. Assets can put arbitrarily named folders. access assets default.yaml preamble.tex, simply use <<indiedown_path>/res path correctly resolved indiedown.

title: Customize Individual R Markdown Templates
text: Indiedown packages use R functions generate LaTeX code customization. customizations, recommended turn default LaTeX title page, create title page via LaTeX commands. basic repertory LaTeX commands \large, \Large, \LARGE, \huge, etc, along vspace{1ex}, LaTeX trickery can applied. LaTeX helper functions put R folder package.

title: Customize Individual R Markdown Templates
text: R Markdown Templates demonstrate use customized style. R Markdown requires put inst/rmarkdown/templates/mytemplate. RStudio recognize show click ‘New R Markdown Document’ ‘Template’. can also use usethis::use_rmarkdown_template() add new template.

title: Introduction to Indiedown
text: indiedown modify default .tex template Pandoc. Instead, modifications applied top . make compliant future releases Pandoc R Markdown. three possible customization points customize indiedown skeleton: Set defaults (fonts geometry) YAML header inst/indiedown/default.yaml Tweak LaTeX settings inst/indiedown/preamble.tex Apply dynamic adjustments pre_processor.R (advanced) See vignette("customize") details.

title: Introduction to Indiedown
text: Indiedown packages use R functions generate LaTeX code customization. customizations, recommended turn default LaTeX title page create title page via LaTeX commands. basic repertory LaTeX commands \large, \Large, \LARGE, \huge, etc, along vspace{1ex}, LaTeX trickery can applied. LaTeX helper functions put R folder package. function cd_page_title() creates example title page can adjusted needs. Note example uses raw strings, available R >= 4. make easy write LaTeX code directly R. See details ?indiedown_glue methods work well R < 4.

title: Walkthrough: Build your own R Markdown Template
text: indiedown modify default .tex template Pandoc. Instead, modifications applied top . make compliant future releases Pandoc R Markdown. three possible customization points customize indiedown skeleton: Set defaults (fonts geometry) YAML header inst/indiedown/default.yaml Tweak LaTeX settings inst/indiedown/preamble.tex Apply dynamic adjustments pre_processor.R (advanced) tutorial, focus first two points .

title: Walkthrough: Build your own R Markdown Template
text: Let’s look inst/indedown/default.yaml: simply defaults custom template. rather adding options YAML header .Rmd time, can stored centrally. can overwrite values .Rmd file. recommended set many customizations possible Pandoc options, fall back LaTeX possible. full list options given LaTeX section Pandoc manual. case, want use slightly wider page margins, change geometry :
code: # indiedown: customize defaults in YAML header here  indent: false compact-title: true subparagraph: true  # needed for titlesec papersize: a4 documentclass: article secnumdepth: 2 fontsize: "11pt"  mainfont: regular.ttf mainfontoptions: - Path=<<indiedown_path>>/fonts/ - BoldFont=bold.ttf - ItalicFont=italic.ttf - BoldItalicFont=bolditalic.ttf - Scale=0.92  linestretch: 1.05  geometry: - top=2cm - bottom=2cm - left=2cm - right=2cm geometry: - top=2.5cm - bottom=2.5cm - left=3cm - right=3cm

title: Walkthrough: Build your own R Markdown Template
text: Changing font fit corporate style usually first step customization. Note <<indiedown_path>> automatically substituted actual location inst/indiedown. can include assets picked template. default template includes free Roboto font, located inst/indiedown. replace proprietary font match corporate design. Instead use helper function get one Google’s free fonts. use_indiedown_gfonts(id = “lato”) function relies gfonts package download install Lato font. don’t know ID font, use gfonts::get_all_fonts() get list available fonts. Let’s preview now:

title: Walkthrough: Build your own R Markdown Template
text: Let’s turn second customization point, preamble.tex. contains LaTeX code run beginning. Add everything changed default.yaml. want use slightly bigger headers, change titlesec line : default.yaml, supports substitution <<indiedown_path>>, link images well. Generally, want many thing . Note default LaTeX title page disabled default template, good reason: Instead, build title page R now.

title: Walkthrough: Build your own R Markdown Template
text: One core principles indiedown keep corporate design elements R code. way, elements can arranged flexibly adjusted particular needs. final step, build customized title page modifying function definition R/cd_page_title. function writes LaTeX code added .Rmd cd_page_title() called. make writing LaTeX code R easy, rely raw string feature added R 4.0.0. allows write pure LaTeX code R, without escape every \ second \\. use version R older, read_tex() function offers alternative way write unescaped LaTeX code. See ?read_tex. indiedown_glue() helper function uses glue package substitute variables string. way, variables title subtitle substituted LaTeX code. indiedown_path_tex(), can also refer path inst/indiedown, use assets package. example, use include logo. Now, don’t want use logo rather photograph beautiful parrot. download image unsplash.com medium quality store res/mikhail-vasilyev-gGC63oug3iY-unsplash.jpg. , change function definition follows: course, also pass image path argument, can choose different title page report. Building package , running template .Rmd, get:

what: Skeleton for a Customized R Markdown Template — create_indiedown_package
title: Skeleton for a Customized R Markdown Template — create_indiedown_package
text: Set packages structure indiedown-based customized R Markdown template. See vignette("indiedown") detailed usage example.

title: Skeleton for a Customized R Markdown Template — create_indiedown_package
Skeleton for a Customized R Markdown Template — create_indiedown_package
text: path Package path overwrite existing assets overwritten?

title: Skeleton for a Customized R Markdown Template — create_indiedown_package
text: function called side effects returns NULL, invisibly.

title: Skeleton for a Customized R Markdown Template — create_indiedown_package
code: path <- file.path(tempdir(), "mydown")  # set up empty R Package 'mydown' create_indiedown_package(path, overwrite = TRUE) #> ✔ indiedown skeleton set up at /tmp/Rtmp9YxN7A/mydown #> ℹ See `vignette("indiedown")` for how to customize the mydown package

title: Download and Use Google Fonts — use_indiedown_gfonts
Download and Use Google Fonts — use_indiedown_gfonts
text: path Package path id Id font, correspond column id get_all_fonts. variants Variant(s) download, default includes available ones.

title: Download and Use Google Fonts — use_indiedown_gfonts
text: function called side effects returns NULL, invisibly.

title: Download and Use Google Fonts — use_indiedown_gfonts
code: # \donttest{ path <- file.path(tempdir(), "mydown") create_indiedown_package(path, overwrite = TRUE) #> ✔ indiedown skeleton set up at /tmp/Rtmp9YxN7A/mydown #> ℹ See `vignette("indiedown")` for how to customize the mydown package # Use Lora, instead of default Roboto use_indiedown_gfonts(   path = path,   id = "lora",   variants = c("regular", "italic", "700", "700italic") ) #> ✔ Added lora fonts # }
